67.translation: [And] who created seven heavens in layers.[1] You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?

67.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱرْجِعِ ٱلْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ
67.translation: Then return [your] vision twice again.[1] [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.

67.arabic: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِمَصَٰبِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَٰهَا رُجُومًا لِّلشَّيَٰطِينِۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
67.translation: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars] and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils[1] and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.

67.arabic: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
67.translation: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.

67.arabic: إِذَآ أُلْقُوا۟ فِيهَا سَمِعُوا۟ لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِىَ تَفُورُ
67.translation: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.

67.arabic: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِۖ كُلَّمَآ أُلْقِىَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ
67.translation: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"

67.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَآءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَٰلٍ كَبِيرٍ
67.translation: They will say, "Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allāh has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"

67.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِىٓ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
67.translation: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."

67.arabic: فَٱعْتَرَفُوا۟ بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًا لِّأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
67.translation: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation[1] for the companions of the Blaze.

67.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَيْبِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ
67.translation: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.

67.arabic: وَأَسِرُّوا۟ قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ ٱجْهَرُوا۟ بِهِۦٓۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
67.translation: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

67.arabic: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
67.translation: Does He who created not know,[1] while He is the Subtle, the Aware?

67.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَٱمْشُوا۟ فِى مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِهِۦۖ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ
67.translation: It is He who made the earth tame[1] for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.

67.arabic: ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَمُورُ
67.translation: Do you feel secure that He who is above[1] would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?[2]

67.arabic: أَمْ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًاۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
67.translation: Or do you feel secure that He who is above would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.

67.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
67.translation: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

67.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَٰٓفَّٰتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍۭ بَصِيرٌ
67.translation: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.

67.arabic: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ جُندٌ لَّكُمْ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِۚ إِنِ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِى غُرُورٍ
67.translation: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.

67.arabic: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُۥۚ بَل لَّجُّوا۟ فِى عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ
67.translation: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.

67.arabic: أَفَمَن يَمْشِى مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦٓ أَهْدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمْشِى سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
67.translation: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?

67.arabic: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَۖ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
67.translation: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful."

67.arabic: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
67.translation: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."

67.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
67.translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

67.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْعِلْمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
67.translation: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allāh, and I am only a clear warner."

67.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيٓـَٔتْ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ
67.translation: But when they see it[1] approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."[2]

67.arabic: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِىَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِىَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
67.translation: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Have you considered:[1] whether Allāh should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

67.arabic: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَاۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
67.translation: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."

67.arabic: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَآؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَآءٍ مَّعِينٍۭ
67.translation: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"

68.translation: Nūn.[1] By the pen and what they inscribe,
You are not, [O Muḥammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
So you will see and they will see
Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

68.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
68.translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
Then do not obey the deniers.
They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
[And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.[1]
Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

68.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
68.translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
We will brand him upon the snout.[1]

68.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
68.translation: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
Without making exception.[1]

68.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
68.translation: So there came upon it [i.e., the garden] an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
And it became as though reaped.
And they called one another at morning,

68.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰرِمِينَ
68.translation: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
So they set out, while lowering their voices,

68.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
68.translation: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.[1]
But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
Rather, we have been deprived."

68.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
68.translation: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allāh]?'"[1]

68.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
68.translation: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.

68.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
68.translation: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."[1]

68.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
68.translation: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

68.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
68.translation: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

68.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
68.translation: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

68.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَٰدِقِينَ
68.translation: Or do they have partners?[1] Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.

68.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
68.translation: The Day the shin will be uncovered[1] and they are invited to prostration but they [i.e., the disbelievers] will not be able,

68.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَٰلِمُونَ
68.translation: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.[1]

68.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
68.translation: So leave Me, [O Muḥammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement [i.e., the Qur’ān]. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.[1]
And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.

68.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
68.translation: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

68.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
68.translation: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muḥammad], and be not like the companion of the fish [i.e., Jonah] when he called out while he was distressed.

68.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
68.translation: If not that a favor [i.e., mercy] from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.[1]
And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

68.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
68.translation: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes [i.e., looks] when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.

69.translation: The Inevitable Reality -
What is the Inevitable Reality?
And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].
So as for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

69.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
69.translation: And as for ʿAad, they were destroyed by a screaming,[1] violent wind

69.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
69.translation: Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
Then do you see of them any remains?

69.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
69.translation: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities[1] with sin.

69.arabic: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
69.translation: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

69.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
69.translation: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried you [i.e., your ancestors] in the sailing ship[1]

69.arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
69.translation: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

69.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
69.translation: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast

69.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
69.translation: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -
Then on that Day, the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,
And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.[1]

69.arabic: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَٰنِيَةٌ
69.translation: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].

69.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
69.translation: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.[1]

69.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَٰبِيَهْ
69.translation: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
So he will be in a pleasant life -
In an elevated garden,
Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

69.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
69.translation: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth[1] in the days past."

69.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهْ
69.translation: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
And had not known what is my account.
I wish it [i.e., my death] had been the decisive one.[1]
My wealth has not availed me.
Gone from me is my authority."[1]
[Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
Then into Hellfire drive him.

69.arabic: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
69.translation: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."

69.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
69.translation: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great,
Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
None will eat it except the sinners.
So I swear by what you see
And what you do not see
[That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word of a noble Messenger.

69.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
69.translation: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.

69.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
69.translation: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
[It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
We would have seized him by the right hand;[1]
Then We would have cut from him the aorta.[1]

69.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَٰجِزِينَ
69.translation: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder for the righteous.
And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

70.translation: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen[1]
To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
[It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.

70.arabic: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
70.translation: The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
So be patient with gracious patience.
Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
But We see it [as] near.
On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,[1]
And the mountains will be like wool,[1]
And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

70.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
70.translation: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
And his wife and his brother
And his nearest kindred who shelter him

70.arabic: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
70.translation: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
No![1] Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
A remover of exteriors.[1]
It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
When evil touches him, impatient,
And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
Except the observers of prayer -
Those who are constant in their prayer
And those within whose wealth is a known right[1]
For the petitioner and the deprived -
And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

70.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
70.translation: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
And those who guard their private parts

70.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
70.translation: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,[1] for indeed, they are not to be blamed -

70.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
70.translation: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
And those who are in their testimonies upright
And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
They will be in gardens,[1] honored.
So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muḥammad],
[To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?[1]

70.arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
70.translation: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.[1]

70.arabic: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
70.translation: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings[1] that indeed We are able

70.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
70.translation: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.

70.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
70.translation: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -

70.arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
70.translation: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.[1]

70.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
70.translation: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.

71.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
71.translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."

71.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
71.translation: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner -

71.arabic: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
71.translation: To worship Allāh, fear Him and obey me.

71.arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
71.translation: He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allāh, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew."

71.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
71.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.

71.arabic: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا
71.translation: But my invitation increased them not except in flight [i.e., aversion].

71.arabic: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا
71.translation: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments,[1] persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.

71.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
71.translation: Then I invited them publicly.

71.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
71.translation: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly

71.arabic: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
71.translation: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.

71.arabic: يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا
71.translation: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers

71.arabic: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّٰتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَٰرًا
71.translation: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.

71.arabic: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
71.translation: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allāh [due] grandeur

71.arabic: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
71.translation: While He has created you in stages?[1]

71.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا
71.translation: Do you not consider how Allāh has created seven heavens in layers[1]

71.arabic: وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
71.translation: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?

71.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
71.translation: And Allāh has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.

71.arabic: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
71.translation: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.

71.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
71.translation: And Allāh has made for you the earth an expanse

71.arabic: لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
71.translation: That you may follow therein roads of passage.'"

71.arabic: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
71.translation: Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.

71.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
71.translation: And they conspired an immense conspiracy

71.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
71.translation: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwāʿ or Yaghūth and Yaʿūq and Nasr.'[1]

71.arabic: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلًا
71.translation: And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."

71.arabic: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًا
71.translation: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allāh [any] helpers.

71.arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
71.translation: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.

71.arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
71.translation: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.

71.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا
71.translation: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."

72.arabic: قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًا
72.translation: Say, [O Muḥammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].

72.arabic: يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًا
72.translation: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
72.translation: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son

72.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًا
72.translation: And that our foolish one [i.e., Iblees][1] has been saying about Allāh an excessive transgression.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا
72.translation: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allāh a lie.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
72.translation: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden [i.e., sin].

72.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًا
72.translation: And they had thought, as you thought, that Allāh would never send anyone [as a messenger].

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
72.translation: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْءَانَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا
72.translation: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing,[1] but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
72.translation: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدًا
72.translation: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.[1]

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُۥ هَرَبًا
72.translation: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allāh upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
72.translation: And when we heard the guidance [i.e., the Qur’ān], we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.[1]

72.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا۟ رَشَدًا
72.translation: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allāh], and among us are the unjust.[1] And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.

72.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا۟ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
72.translation: But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'

72.arabic: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسْتَقَٰمُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقًا
72.translation: And [Allāh revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant rain [i.e., provision]

72.arabic: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
72.translation: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[1] He will put into arduous punishment.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّ ٱلْمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدًا
72.translation: And [He revealed] that the masjids[1] are for Allāh, so do not invoke[2] with Allāh anyone.

72.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا۟ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
72.translation: And that when the Servant [i.e., Prophet] of Allāh stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."[1]

72.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
72.translation: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."

72.arabic: قُلْ إِنِّى لَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
72.translation: Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."

72.arabic: قُلْ إِنِّى لَن يُجِيرَنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا
72.translation: Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allāh anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.

72.arabic: إِلَّا بَلَٰغًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا
72.translation: But [I have for you] only notification from Allāh, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.

72.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
72.translation: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.

72.arabic: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَمَدًا
72.translation: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."

72.arabic: عَٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
72.translation: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone

72.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسْلُكُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ رَصَدًا
72.translation: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before him [i.e., each messenger] and behind him observers[1]

72.arabic: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا۟ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عَدَدًۢا
72.translation: That he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] may know[1] that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.

73.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ
73.translation: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],[1]

73.arabic: قُمِ ٱلَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
73.translation: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -

73.arabic: نِّصْفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
73.translation: Half of it - or subtract from it a little

73.arabic: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا
73.translation: Or add to it, and recite the Qur’ān with measured recitation.

73.arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِى عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.[1]

73.arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطْـًٔا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue][1] and more suitable for words.[2]

73.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.

73.arabic: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
73.translation: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.

73.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
73.translation: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.[1]

73.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
73.translation: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.

73.arabic: وَذَرْنِى وَٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُو۟لِى ٱلنَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
73.translation: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.

73.arabic: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَآ أَنكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا
73.translation: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire

73.arabic: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
73.translation: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -

73.arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا
73.translation: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.

73.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
73.translation: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

73.arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَٰهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
73.translation: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.

73.arabic: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ ٱلْوِلْدَٰنَ شِيبًا
73.translation: Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white-haired?[1]

73.arabic: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرٌۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَفْعُولًا
73.translation: The heaven will break apart therefrom;[1] ever is His promise fulfilled.

73.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
73.translation: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.

73.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَىِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٌ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْۖ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلْقُرْءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰۙ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِۙ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُۚ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًاۚ وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌۢ
73.translation: Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muḥammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allāh determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it[1] and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur’ān. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allāh and others fighting for the cause of Allāh. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakāh and loan Allāh a goodly loan.[2] And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allāh. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

74.translation: O you who covers himself [with a garment],[1]
Arise and warn
And your Lord glorify
And your clothing purify
And uncleanliness[1] avoid
And do not confer favor to acquire more[1]
But for your Lord be patient.
And when the trumpet is blown,
That Day will be a difficult day
For the disbelievers - not easy.
Leave Me with the one I created alone[1]
And to whom I granted extensive wealth
And children present [with him]
And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
Then he desires that I should add more.
No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
I will cover him with arduous torment.
Indeed, he thought and deliberated.[1]
So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
Then he considered [again];
Then he frowned and scowled;
Then he turned back and was arrogant

74.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ
74.translation: And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
This is not but the word of a human being."
I will drive him into Saqar.[1]
And what can make you know what is Saqar?
It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
Altering [i.e., blackening] the skins.
Over it are nineteen [angels].

74.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةًۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَيَزْدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِيمَٰنًاۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَۙ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِىَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
74.translation: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allāh intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allāh send astray whom He wills and guide whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And it [i.e., mention of the Fire] is not but a reminder to humanity.
No! By the moon
And [by] the night when it departs
And [by] the morning when it brightens,
Indeed, it [i.e., the Fire] is of the greatest [afflictions]
As a warning to humanity -

74.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
74.translation: To whoever wills among you to proceed[1] or stay behind.
Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained[1]
Except the companions of the right,[1].
[Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
About the criminals,
[And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
Nor did we used to feed the poor.
And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
Until there came to us the certainty [i.e., death]."
So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
As if they were alarmed donkeys
Fleeing from a lion?

74.arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُّنَشَّرَةً
74.translation: Rather, every person among them desires that he[1] would be given scriptures spread about.[2]
No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
No! Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder
Then whoever wills will remember it.

74.arabic: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ
74.translation: And they will not remember except that Allāh wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.

75.translation: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
And I swear by the reproaching soul[1] [to the certainty of resurrection].
Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?

75.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
75.translation: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
But man desires to continue in sin.[1]
He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
So when vision is dazzled
And the moon darkens
And the sun and the moon are joined,
Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
No! There is no refuge.
To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.

75.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
75.translation: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead[1] and kept back.[2]
Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,[1]
Even if he presents his excuses.

75.arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
75.translation: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muḥammad], to hasten with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān].
Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
No! But you [i.e., mankind] love the immediate
And leave [i.e., neglect] the Hereafter.
[Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
Looking at their Lord.[1]
And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
No! When it [i.e., the soul] has reached the collar bones[1]
And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
And he [i.e., the dying one] is certain that it is the [time of] separation
And the leg is wound about the leg,[1]
To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.[1]
And he [i.e., the disbeliever] had not believed, nor had he prayed.
But [instead], he denied and turned away.
And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
Woe to you, and woe!
Then woe to you, and woe!
Does man think that he will be left neglected?[1]

75.arabic: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِّن مَّنِىٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
75.translation: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allāh] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
And made of him two mates, the male and the female.

75.arabic: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحْۦِىَ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ
75.translation: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?

76.arabic: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَٰنِ حِينٌ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًٔا مَّذْكُورًا
76.translation: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?

76.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا
76.translation: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture[1] that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.

76.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
76.translation: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.

76.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَٰلًا وَسَعِيرًا
76.translation: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.

76.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
76.translation: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,[1]

76.arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
76.translation: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].

76.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًا
76.translation: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

76.arabic: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
76.translation: And they give food in spite of love for it[1] to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,

76.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
76.translation: [Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.

76.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
76.translation: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."

76.arabic: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
76.translation: So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness

76.arabic: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا
76.translation: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].

76.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
76.translation: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.

76.arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
76.translation: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.

76.arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا۠
76.translation: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],

76.arabic: قَوَارِيرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا
76.translation: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.

76.arabic: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
76.translation: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger

76.arabic: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا
76.translation: [From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.

76.arabic: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا
76.translation: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.

76.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
76.translation: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.

76.arabic: عَٰلِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌۖ وَحُلُّوٓا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
76.translation: Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.

76.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَآءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
76.translation: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."

76.arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَنزِيلًا
76.translation: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.

76.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ ءَاثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
76.translation: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].

76.arabic: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
76.translation: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

76.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَٱسْجُدْ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
76.translation: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.

76.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
76.translation: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them[1] a grave Day.

76.arabic: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
76.translation: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.

76.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
76.translation: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.

76.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
76.translation: And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

76.arabic: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا
76.translation: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.

77.translation: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
And the winds that blow violently
And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
And those [angels] who bring criterion[1]
And those [angels] who deliver a message
As justification or warning,
Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
So when the stars are obliterated
And when the heaven is opened
And when the mountains are blown away
And when the messengers' time has come...[1]
For what Day was it postponed?[1]
For the Day of Judgement.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
Woe,[1] that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not destroy the former peoples?
Then We will follow them with the later ones.
Thus do We deal with the criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
And We placed it in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb]
For a known extent.
And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Have We not made the earth a container
Of the living and the dead?

77.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ شَٰمِخَٰتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَٰكُم مَّآءً فُرَاتًا
77.translation: And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

77.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
77.translation: [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.

77.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِى ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٍ
77.translation: Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns

77.arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ
77.translation: [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is a Day they will not speak,
Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
And fruits from whatever they desire,

77.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
77.translation: [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
[O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

77.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرْكَعُوا۟ لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
77.translation: And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
Then in what statement after it [i.e., the Qur’ān] will they believe?

78.translation: About what are they asking one another?
About the great news[1] -
That over which they are in disagreement.
No! They are going to know.
Then, no! They are going to know.
Have We not made the earth a resting place?
And the mountains as stakes?[1]
And We created you in pairs
And made your sleep [a means for] rest
And made the night as clothing[1]
And made the day for livelihood
And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]
And made [therein] a burning lamp
And sent down from the rain clouds pouring water
That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation
And gardens of entwined growth.
Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -

78.arabic: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا
78.translation: The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes
And the heaven is opened and will become gateways
And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.
Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait
For the transgressors, a place of return,
In which they will remain for ages [unending].

78.arabic: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا
78.translation: They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink.
Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -
An appropriate recompense.[1]
Indeed, they were not expecting an account
And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.
But all things We have enumerated in writing.
"So taste [the penalty], and never will We increase you except in torment."[1]
Indeed, for the righteous is attainment[1] -
Gardens and grapevines
And young women [companions] of equal age.
And a full cup.[1]

78.arabic: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّٰبًا
78.translation: No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -
[As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,[1]

78.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا
78.translation: [From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.[1]

78.arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفًّاۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا
78.translation: The Day that the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.

78.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلْحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
78.translation: That is the True [i.e., certain] Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.[1]

78.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنذَرْنَٰكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْكَافِرُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى كُنتُ تُرَٰبًۢا
78.translation: Indeed, We have warned you of an impending punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth[1] and the disbeliever will say, "Oh, I wish that I were dust!"

79.translation: By those [angels] who extract with violence[1]
And [by] those who remove with ease[1]
And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming[1]
And those who race each other in a race[1]
And those who arrange [each] matter,[1]
On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
There will follow it the subsequent [one].
Hearts,[1] that Day, will tremble,
Their eyes[1] humbled.
They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
Even if we should be decayed bones?"[1]
They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."[1]
Indeed, it will be but one shout,
And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
Has there reached you the story of Moses? -

79.arabic: إِذْ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
79.translation: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā,
"Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

79.arabic: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
79.translation: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
And he showed him the greatest sign,[1]
But he [i.e., Pharaoh] denied and disobeyed.
Then he turned his back, striving [i.e., plotting].[1]
And he gathered [his people] and called out
And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
So Allāh seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].[1].

79.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰٓ
79.translation: Indeed in that is a lesson [i.e., warning] for whoever would fear [Allāh].

79.arabic: ءَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا
79.translation: Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He [i.e., Allāh] constructed it.
He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.[1]
And after that He spread the earth.
He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
And the mountains He set firmly
As enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity[1] -
The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
So as for he who transgressed
And preferred the life of the world,
Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.

79.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفْسَ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ
79.translation: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord[1] and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?[1]
In what [position] are you that you should mention it?[1]
To your Lord is its finality.[1]
You are only a warner for those who fear it.

79.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَىٰهَا
79.translation: It will be, on the Day they see it,[1] as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.

80.translation: He [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ) ] frowned and turned away
Because there came to him the blind man,[1] [interrupting].
But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad], that perhaps he might be purified[1]
Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
As for he who thinks himself without need,[1]
To him you give attention.
And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.[1]
But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]
While he fears [Allāh],
From him you are distracted.
No! Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;
So whoever wills may remember it.[1]
[It is recorded] in honored sheets,
Exalted and purified,
[Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
Noble and dutiful.
Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man;[1] how disbelieving is he.
From what thing [i.e., substance] did He create him?
From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;[1]
Then He eased the way for him;[1]
Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.[1]
Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
No! He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.
Then let mankind look at his food -
How We poured down water in torrents,
Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],
And caused to grow within it grain
And grapes and herbage
And olive and palm trees
And gardens of dense shrubbery
And fruit and grass -
[As] enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
But when there comes the Deafening Blast[1]
On the Day a man will flee from his brother
And his mother and his father
And his wife and his children,

80.arabic: لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
80.translation: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.[1]
[Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -
Laughing, rejoicing at good news.
And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.
Blackness will cover them.
Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.

81.translation: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
And when the stars fall, dispersing,
And when the mountains are removed
And when full-term she-camels[1] are neglected
And when the wild beasts are gathered
And when the seas are filled with flame[1]
And when the souls are paired[1]
And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
For what sin she was killed
And when the pages[1] are spread [i.e., made public]
And when the sky is stripped away
And when Hellfire is set ablaze
And when Paradise is brought near,
A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].[1]
So I swear by the retreating stars -
Those that run [their courses] and disappear [i.e., set]
And by the night as it closes in[1]
And by the dawn when it breathes [i.e., stirs]
[That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger [i.e., Gabriel]

81.arabic: ذِى قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِى ٱلْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
81.translation: [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
And your companion [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) ] is not [at all] mad.[1]
And he has already seen him [i.e., Gabriel] in the clear horizon.[1]
And he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.[1]
And it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
So where are you going?[1]
It is not except a reminder to the worlds
For whoever wills among you to take a right course.

81.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
81.translation: And you do not will except that Allāh wills - Lord of the worlds.

82.translation: And when the stars fall, scattering,
And when the seas are erupted
And when the [contents of] graves are scattered [i.e., exposed],
A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.

82.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
82.translation: O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,
Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?

82.arabic: فِىٓ أَىِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
82.translation: In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.
No! But you deny the Recompense.
And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,[1]
Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,
And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.
They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,
And never therefrom will they be absent.
And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?

82.arabic: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
82.translation: Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?

82.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِّنَفْسٍ شَيْـًٔاۖ وَٱلْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلَّهِ
82.translation: It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allāh.

83.translation: Woe to those who give less [than due],[1]

83.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
83.translation: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
Do they not think that they will be resurrected
For a tremendous Day -
The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

83.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
83.translation: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
It is [their destination[1] recorded in] a register inscribed.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
Who deny the Day of Recompense.

83.arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
83.translation: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.

83.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
83.translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."

83.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَلْۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
83.translation: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.[1]

83.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
83.translation: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.[1]
Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.

83.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
83.translation: Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."

83.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
83.translation: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in ʿilliyyūn.
And what can make you know what is ʿilliyyūn?
It is [their destination[1] recorded in] a register inscribed
Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allāh].
Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
On adorned couches, observing.
You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
They will be given to drink [pure] wine[1] [which was] sealed.

83.arabic: خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ
83.translation: The last of it[1] is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
And its mixture is of Tasneem,[1]
A spring from which those near [to Allāh] drink.

83.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
83.translation: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.

83.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
83.translation: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.

83.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
83.translation: And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
But they had not been sent as guardians over them.

83.arabic: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
83.translation: So Today[1] those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
On adorned couches, observing.

83.arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
83.translation: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?

84.translation: When the sky has split [open]
And has listened [i.e., responded][1] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
And when the earth has been extended[1]
And has cast out that within it[1] and relinquished [it]
And has listened [i.e., responded] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] –

84.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
84.translation: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion[1] and will meet it.[2]
Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
He will be judged with an easy account
And return to his people in happiness.

84.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِۦ
84.translation: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
He will cry out for destruction
And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allāh].

84.arabic: بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرًا
84.translation: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Seeing.
So I swear by the twilight glow
And [by] the night and what it envelops
And [by] the moon when it becomes full
[That] you will surely embark upon [i.e., experience] state after state.[1]
So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

84.arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ۩
84.translation: And when the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allāh]?
But those who have disbelieved deny,
And Allāh is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

84.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۭ
84.translation: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.

85.translation: By the sky containing great stars
And [by] the promised Day
And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,
Destroyed [i.e., cursed] were the companions of the trench[1]
[Containing] the fire full of fuel,
When they were sitting near it.

85.arabic: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
85.translation: And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses. [1]

85.arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
85.translation: And they resented them not except because they believed in Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,

85.arabic: ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
85.translation: To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh, over all things, is Witness.[1]

85.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
85.translation: Indeed, those who have tortured[1] the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.

85.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
85.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
Indeed, the assault [i.e., vengeance] of your Lord is severe.
Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.
And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,
Honorable Owner of the Throne,
Effecter of what He intends.
Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -
[Those of] Pharaoh and Thamūd?
But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,
While Allāh encompasses them from behind.[1]
But this is an honored Qur’ān
[Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.

86.translation: By the sky and the knocker
And what can make you know what is the knocker?

86.arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
86.translation: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
So let man observe from what he was created.
He was created from a fluid, ejected,
Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
Indeed, He [i.e., Allāh], to return him [to life], is Able.
The Day when secrets will be put on trial,[1]

86.arabic: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
86.translation: Then he [i.e., man] will have no power or any helper.
By the sky which sends back[1]
Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a decisive statement,
Indeed, they are planning a plan,
But I am planning a plan.
So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.[1]

87.translation: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
And who brings out the pasture
We will make you recite, [O Muḥammad], and you will not forget,

87.arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
87.translation: Except what Allāh should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
And We will ease you toward ease.[1]
So remind, if the reminder should benefit;[1]
He who fears [Allāh] will be reminded.
But the wretched one will avoid it –
[He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,

87.arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ

87.translation: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
But you prefer the worldly life,
While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

88.translation: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
[Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
Working [hard] and exhausted.[1]
They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
They will be given drink from a boiling spring.

88.arabic: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
88.translation: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant

88.arabic: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِن جُوعٍ
88.translation: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
[Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
With their effort [they are] satisfied
In an elevated garden,
Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.[1]
Within it is a flowing spring.
Within it are couches raised high
And cups put in place
And cushions lined up
And carpets spread around.

88.arabic: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
88.translation: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
And at the sky - how it is raised?
And at the mountains - how they are erected?
And at the earth - how it is spread out?
So remind, [O Muḥammad]; you are only a reminder.
You are not over them a controller.
However, he who turns away and disbelieves –
Then Allāh will punish him with the greatest punishment.
Indeed, to Us is their return.
Then indeed, upon Us is their account.

89.translation: By the dawn
And [by] ten nights[1]
And [by] the even [number] and the odd
And [by] the night when it passes,

89.arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
89.translation: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?[1]

89.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
89.translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -
[With] Iram[1] - who had lofty pillars,[2]

89.arabic: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَٰدِ
89.translation: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes?[1]
[All of] whom oppressed within the lands
And increased therein the corruption.
So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

89.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
89.translation: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."[1]

89.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَٰنَنِ
89.translation: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
No![1] But you do not honor the orphan
And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,[1]
And you love wealth with immense love.

89.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
89.translation: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed
And your Lord has come[1] and the angels, rank upon rank,

89.arabic: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
89.translation: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?
He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."[1]
So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
[To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
And enter among My [righteous] servants
And enter My Paradise."

90.translation: I swear by this city [i.e., Makkah] –
And you, [O Muḥammad], are free of restriction in this city –
And [by] the father[1] and that which was born [of him],
We have certainly created man into hardship.

90.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
90.translation: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
Does he think that no one has seen him?
Have We not made for him two eyes?
And a tongue and two lips?
And have shown him the two ways?[1]
But he has not broken through the difficult pass.[1]
And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
It is the freeing of a slave

90.arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَٰمٌ فِى يَوْمٍ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍ
90.translation: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
An orphan of near relationship
Or a needy person in misery

90.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
90.translation: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
Those are the companions of the right.[1]

90.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
90.translation: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.[1]
Over them will be fire closed in.[1]

91.translation: By the sun and its brightness
And [by] the moon when it follows it
And [by] the day when it displays it[1]
And [by] the night when it covers [i.e., conceals] it
And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
And [by] the earth and He who spread it
And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it[1]
And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
He has succeeded who purifies it,
And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
Thamūd denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
When the most wretched of them was sent forth.[1]

91.arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقْيَٰهَا
91.translation: And the messenger of Allāh [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allāh or [prevent her from] her drink."

91.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
91.translation: But they denied him and hamstrung[1] her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
And He does not fear the consequence thereof.[1]

92.translation: By the night when it covers[1]
And [by] the day when it appears
And [by] He who created the male and female,
Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
As for he who gives and fears Allāh
And believes in the best [reward].
We will ease him toward ease.
But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
And denies the best [reward],
We will ease him toward difficulty.

92.arabic: وَمَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ
92.translation: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?[1]
Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
And indeed, to us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one
Who had denied and turned away.
But the righteous one will avoid it –
[He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself

92.arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰٓ
92.translation: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded[1] –
But only seeking the face [i.e., acceptance] of his Lord, Most High.
And he is going to be satisfied.

93.translation: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,[1]
Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muḥammad], nor has He detested [you].
And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
And He found you lost and guided [you],
And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.
So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
And as for the petitioner,[1] do not repel [him].
