But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].

94.translation: Did We not expand for you, [O Muḥammad], your breast?[1]
And We removed from you your burden[1]
Which had weighed upon your back
And raised high for you your repute.
For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease [i.e., relief].
So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
And to your Lord direct [your] longing.

95.translation: By the fig and the olive[1]

95.arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
95.translation: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;[1]
Then We return him to the lowest of the low,[1]

95.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
95.translation: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?[1]
Is not Allāh the most just of judges?

96.translation: Recite in the name of your Lord who created –
Created man from a clinging substance.
Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
Taught man that which he knew not.
Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
Have you seen the one who forbids
Have you seen if he is upon guidance
Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
Does he not know that Allāh sees?

96.arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
96.translation: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock[1] –
Then let him call his associates;
We will call the angels of Hell.[1]
No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allāh].

97.translation: Indeed, We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down during the Night of Decree.
And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?

97.arabic: لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
97.translation: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.

97.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
97.translation: The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.[1]
Peace it is[1] until the emergence of dawn.

98.arabic: لَمْ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
98.translation: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief][1] until there came to them clear evidence –

98.arabic: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتْلُوا۟ صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً
98.translation: A Messenger from Allāh, reciting purified[1] scriptures
Within which are correct writings [i.e., rulings and laws].

98.arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
98.translation: Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided[1] until after there had come to them clear evidence.

98.arabic: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلْقَيِّمَةِ
98.translation: And they were not commanded except to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakāh. And that is the correct religion.

98.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ فِى نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآۚ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
98.translation: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.

98.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
98.translation: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.

98.arabic: جَزَآؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًاۖ رَّضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِىَ رَبَّهُۥ
98.translation: Their reward with their Lord will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allāh being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.

99.translation: When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
And the earth discharges its burdens[1]
And man says,[1] "What is [wrong] with it?" -
That Day, it will report its news
Because your Lord has inspired [i.e., commanded] it.

99.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا۟ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ
99.translation: That Day, the people will depart[1] separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.

99.arabic: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُۥ
99.translation: So whoever does an atom's weight[1] of good will see it,

99.arabic: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُۥ
99.translation: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.

100.translation: And the producers of sparks [when] striking[1]
Arriving thereby in the center[1] collectively,
Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
And indeed, he is to that a witness.[1]
And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.

100.arabic: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ
100.translation: But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered
And that within the breasts is obtained,[1]
Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Aware.[1]

101.translation: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,[1]
And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.[1]
Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
He will be in a pleasant life.
But as for one whose scales are light,
His refuge[1] will be an abyss.[2]
And what can make you know what that is?
It is a Fire, intensely hot.

102.translation: No! You are going to know.
Then, no! You are going to know.
No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...[1]
You will surely see the Hellfire.
Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.[1]
Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.[1]

103.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ
103.translation: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.

104.translation: Woe to every scorner and mocker
Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.[1]
He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.[1]
And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
It is the fire of Allāh, [eternally] fueled,
Which mounts directed at the hearts.[1]
Indeed, it [i.e., Hellfire] will be closed down upon them

105.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْفِيلِ
105.translation: Have you not considered, [O Muḥammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?[1]
Did He not make their plan into misguidance?[1]
And He sent against them birds in flocks,
Striking them with stones of hard clay,
And He made them like eaten straw.[1]

106.translation: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1] -
Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer[1] -
Let them worship the Lord of this House,[1]

106.arabic: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍۭ
106.translation: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.

107.translation: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
For that is the one who drives away the orphan
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
So woe to those who pray
[But] who are heedless of their prayer[1] -
Those who make show [of their deeds]

108.translation: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muḥammad], al-Kawthar.
So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice [to Him alone].
Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.[1]

109.translation: I do not worship what you worship.
Nor are you worshippers of what I worship.
Nor will I be a worshipper of what you worship.
Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.
For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."

110.translation: When the victory of Allāh has come and the conquest,[1]

110.arabic: وَرَأَيْتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِى دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
110.translation: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allāh in multitudes,

110.arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابًۢا
110.translation: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.[1]

111.translation: May the hands of Abū Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.[1]

111.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ
111.translation: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame
And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.[1]
Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.

112.translation: He neither begets nor is born,
Nor is there to Him any equivalent."

113.translation: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
From the evil of that which He created
And from the evil of darkness when it settles
And from the evil of the blowers in knots[1]
And from the evil of an envier when he envies."

114.translation: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,
From the evil of the retreating whisperer[1] -
Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -
From among the jinn and mankind."[1]
